intro: Spermacoce cerradoana, commonly known as the cerrado spiderling, is a flowering plant native to the Cerrado biome of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats and has slender, branching stems. Its flowers are small and white, often with a slight pinkish hue, and it produces small, round berries. Spermacoce cerradoana plays a role in the ecological dynamics of the Cerrado, supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
